website_summaries.verdict: Straightforward setup and consistently strong connections make this a very good overall router at a competitive price.
pros: Parental controls are easy to set up via PC and adjust using its companion app
Good signal strength and speed, with broadband streaming not a problem
cons: Instruction manual skips some important points, like button locations and functions
Some signal degradation occurs in rooms farther away from router

customer_reviews.title: well the first week works awesome but the second week i start notice my devices ...
customer_reviews.text: well the first week works awesome but the second week i start notice my devices looks ok but not open any webside so i contact linksys the only answer was reset the router , resetting will fix it but only for couple hours nd u have to resetting again , looks a lot of people has the same problem, after researching its a software issue but linksys did not fix it and looks they wont fix it thats a shame but not worth it waiting, i have to return it
customer_reviews.author: jose ortiz

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this
customer_reviews.text: The router will work fine, until the firmware auto updates, then you will no longer be able to log in and manage your router. This has been ongoing for years. Once it becomes inaccessible, all you can do it a hard reset and set up your router again. Then inevitably, even though you select "do not update firmware", linksys will push you the firmware and you will be unable to login to your router again. Do a quick google search, and you will see all the users continually frustrated with the lack of response to this issue.
customer_reviews.author: Blake

customer_reviews.title: Setup was easy and the speed is blazing fast
customer_reviews.text: Setup was easy and the speed is blazing fast. However, those few good things really don't matter if you can't stay connected. It works for 5 or 10 min at very most and then the connection drops. However, it still appears as though you are connected when looking at the signal bars, but nothing works. After a few minutes, it starts working again and repeats the cycle all over again. I checked to make sure I had latest firmware, all my settings were correct etc. My old Linksys router that was made by Cisco was a workhorse that gave me zero problems over many years. This new generation Linksys made by Belkin really disappoints.
customer_reviews.author: RE

customer_reviews.title: great for truly fast internet
customer_reviews.text: This is a dual band wifi router, meaning it will have 2 log on options; 2.4g or 5g. If you hvae an ISP that gets 500mbps - 1g of service per second, you will wnat the 5g, as the most you will get on the 2.4g log on is aobut 100mbps. Also, just a note, if you do have the 500mbps wifi speed, then you are going to want to get CAT7 or CAT8 ethernet cords that can handle that kind of speed. Otherwise you will only get the 100mbps even if you have more coming in as the wiring makes a huge difference.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Nevitt

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely no good if you have mixed 5g & 2.4g devices
customer_reviews.text: I've been Linksys for 16 years. So sad about this device. Upgraded to this model to actually take care of some dead spots in the house. what happened was that the 2.4g band kept dropping out ---- there are still devices in the house that are on 2.4g that need full streaming for Netflix that I never had issues with before. After researching on internet I found whole forum threads dedicated to this unsolvable issue, where the end result was to simply buy another router. If you're a 5g household only using the router, no issues. If you have mixed devices that require full streaming, forget it. And yes, I've done all the fixes and workarounds I could find.
customer_reviews.author: W!

customer_reviews.title: Great router with features if you dig in
customer_reviews.text: Awesome dual-band router. I use it as a switch for hard-wired devices, and it works exactly as it should. It hasn't been rebooted once in the few months I've owned it. Strong signal all over my house and outside. My phone picks up the wifi signal half a city block down. Customization is great. The "guest account" feature is awesome if you're hosting guests/air bnb. Just change the password after they leave. Dual bands are great for older devices and newer. My raspberry pi zero w can't do 5ghz. It automatically picks up the 2.4ghz channel. This is a great, configurable router with some nice security features.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Instructions are NOT clear or complete for people who are NOT technically inclined
customer_reviews.text: The instructions (small book) are NOT clear or complete for people who are NOT technically inclined. They make it sound like it is a piece of cake..."plug and play"....NOT SO. I am technically competent (Bachelor in Computer science) and have very little difficulty in stalling equipment or software....but this one I had to call Technical support to get it set up and working. Linksys needs to provide clear and detailed installation instruction....the information that the Tech support told me when installing, if it had been in an instruction book, could have made the process a lot less stressful. Love the unit. just documentation lacking.
customer_reviews.author: Larry J. Arszman

customer_reviews.title: Mediocre to poor performance
customer_reviews.text: This is my first Linksys product. I always knew that Linksys has a good name, so I was sure that I'm getting a decent router. I purchased this one after I broke my Netgear R7000, and what a disappointment it is. On paper, the specs are almost identical, but in reality, the performance is so poor. Reception is much weaker than the Netgear, and the transfer speed between my desktop computer (connected to a wired port) and my laptop (which is connected wirelessly) is simply terrible. Around 4Mb/s (32Mbit/s) on both the 2.4Ghz network and the 5Ghz network - this is also when they are next to each other (1-2 meters far from each other).
customer_reviews.author: Tal

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed with Linksys
customer_reviews.text: The worst router I have ever had. Bought to replace an older Linksys router that was about 8 years old. This ac1750 dropped my service to a download rate a little above 1.0 mb. And setup was a nightmare. I had to hookup to router with Ethernet cable to get the setup screen to display. And have not been able to successfully login to my account since I have unplugged the Ethernet cable. I will be uninstalling tomorrow. This is horrible. Going back to my old router until I can get a netgear or something that actually works. It works poorly with either 5.0 or 2.4. So disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Jody M - Wisconsin

customer_reviews.title: Yet another terrific Linksys purchase.
customer_reviews.text: I recently upgraded the speed of my internet with my ISP. I figured it was also time to upgrade my flawless 10 year old Linksys router with a new model. The MU-MIMO feature wasn't a major consideration as I don't have any MU-MIMO devices yet (hoping that more manufacturers will get on board with this technology... APPLE?!). After a very easy set-up and living with the router about a week, I'm very happy. With the router situated in my basement, streaming, downloading, wi-fi calling, etc. have all been exceptional upstairs. Speed tests on my desktop (which is connected by wi-fi) have been in the 60 Mbps range - more than satisfactory. Linksys has yet to disappoint!
customer_reviews.author: Eric J. McClellan

customer_reviews.title: It's meh
customer_reviews.text: It's meh. Keeps trying to swap me to the lower speed wifi. My friend said it would help my internet, I haven't really noticed a difference. Only reason I kept it is because you can prioritize devices and my roommate does not know this so all mine are prioritized. Otherwise whatever spectrum (or whomever) gives you should be fine. Don't buy
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel Carli-Jones

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy if you need parental controls
customer_reviews.text: We're having issues with parental controls not working. It blocks devices that are in the timeframe where the wifi should be working, & allows devices where it is supposed to be blocked. Right now we're doing school from home, & this router is blocking the wifi for the kid's school computer, but not his iPhone. Very frustrating, feel like it has been a colossal waste of money. Also, very annoying that the times are only on the hour, you can't set the controls for the wifi to turn on/off on a device at say 8:30. Only 8 or 9. I've read a lot of other people's complaints about this very same thing on other forums & there's been no resolution.
customer_reviews.author: GoodyISU1

customer_reviews.title: Parental controls do not work
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this router if you want to use the parental control features. Sometimes it works, sometimes it does not. I regularly find my son streaming video on his phone (which has no data service) during his restricted hours. He is not connecting to any other network. I can see he is connected to the wifi via the app, which shows that internet is paused for that device, yet he is still able to stream video. I bought this router specifically for the parental controls, and I was misled by linksys' marketing. It's past the 30 day return period, or I would send it back. At this point I'm not willing to buy any more linksys products.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Trash - setup poor, reliability poor
customer_reviews.text: Don't bother - Linksys used to be a good brand and this unit is supposed to be highly rated, but by who? Maybe only the marketing department at Linksys!!! The setup process is long and difficult, requiring multiple restarts and registration on their website just to setup the local router! Many options just aren't present, devices have a hard time connecting. And I've got devices that are randomly disconnected and disabled. Go back to the Netgear products - at least their easy to use and reliable. I'm 5 hours into the process and giving up. This goes back in the box for a return. Save your money - buy a Netgear router!
customer_reviews.author: Jon F. Gray

customer_reviews.title: Failure Rate, Mine failed
customer_reviews.text: I don't know who own Linksys now but the quality has slipped. I own several and well, don't think I will get another. This one was a Refurbished one. I suggest, Don't get one that is Refurbished with its 90 day warranty. Reason is, Intermittent issues. Like this one has. It was returned, and checked but they did not find the problem with it and well, it might be ok for a week and then drops off. When its working the performance seems fine but take some time and Read All the Reviews. I need to replace this thing and going with something different for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Helmar

customer_reviews.title: Every few months you get to sit with tech support to fix issues that should never happen.
customer_reviews.text: If you enjoy hours of online tech support and having your provider blame you modem and this company avoid any useful discussions. Place sign up for one.
customer_reviews.author: Evelyn cedeno-castro

customer_reviews.title: Stunning! Got FAR more than I expected!
customer_reviews.text: I replaced my previous Cisco router with this one hoping it would allocate priorities among devices better (Wi-Fi streaming was overwhelming ethernet, causing video pixilation on the two ethernet connected computers. That issue was quickly resolved but I was thrilled to discover that FILE TRANSFER SPEEDS between the two computers shot up from a crawling 11.5 Megs/second to well over 113. Seems I'm now finally enjoying the benefits of a great router (plus having installed cat6 cables long before the industry caught up with their increased capacity to move data). Easy installation, up and running in less than 5 minutes. Easy to understand. Consumer friendly interface (not just for geeks). Hope to heck it holds up!!
customer_reviews.author: carolyn

customer_reviews.title: Great upgrade!
customer_reviews.text: My old (and I mean OLD) router needed to be replaced. My streaming services were constantly pausing or simply quitting. After contacting my internet provider and checking my speeds it was determined that my router was crap (download speeds in KILOBITES!?!) I immediately purchased this new Linksys. It was simple to set up and soon all my devices - computer, phones, tablets were downloading at 110 MBS. Well, that’s more like it!! This Linksys works beyond expectations and is wallet friendly. I highly recommend this router.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Magoomba

customer_reviews.title: Won't connect to the Linksys Smart Cloud
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for our church, and we are returning it. We have a small church and I wanted something that could be easily operated. Linksys has a good reputation, and has generated quality devices for years, but this one has problems. The biggest issue I had was the fact that it won't connect to their cloud service for remote management. There's very little documentation on it, and there were NO software updates for it, even though it's been out for a while. I'm replacing it with an AC1200 version, and it seems to work flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy Willett

customer_reviews.title: Refurbished or New? it does not work properly after 4 months. UPDATE!!!
customer_reviews.text: I am not sure if this was a refurbished router, but after 4 months it stopped working properly. I called tech support and they reset it and they worked on it for an hour and still nothing. I lose connection every 5 to 10 minutes, every device gets disconnected and I am wasting a lot of time logging back into every session I am working on. ***This is an update from my last review. I've also been having trouble setting up parental controls, so when I called support I was informed that that feature DOES NOT work on this product. Nothing they can do... what?
customer_reviews.author: Alex Perez

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable
customer_reviews.text: I am not a techie so please bear with me. This was a replacement router for an old Linksys that just stopped working one day (it worked great before that). It was easy to set up (for a non-technical type). The router is in the same room as the tablet and Xbox. I immediately noticed connection issues with various devices: tablet spinning constantly looking for a connection, Xbox dropping connection (I have to sign into my account almost every other time). I am convinced it is the router as I have never had these problems before. I checked the power input as one reviewer suggested but that was not an issue.
customer_reviews.author: FloodGate

customer_reviews.title: Really impressed
customer_reviews.text: Cox gave "free" upgrade to 150mps and the old router throttled it to 80. This seemed like the best price point for gigabit ports & AC class wireless. (It was much less $$ when I picked it up.) The 5ghz band just screams on our Samsung S9, iPhone 8, MacBook. The 5ghz range is also excellent, easily matching the range of the 2.4 band, with equal speeds at the very limits. Web interface is straightforward. Just an illuminated logo on front, so good for bedrooms in terms of low light output, not much info though. Only minor complaint is it's big compared to old router. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: k s

customer_reviews.title: worked for less then 2 months
customer_reviews.text: Please don't waste your time and money. This product worked fine for less then 2 months(outside the 1 month window when you can return it to Amazon) and then just quit dead. Won't even rebot. I contacted the customer service and will update this if and when I hear back from them -but I am not holding my breath. If you are good with spending about $90 for less then 2 months of use then you should order this product.
customer_reviews.author: mother of three

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product from a excellent company.
customer_reviews.text: Custimer support is excellent, considering staffing levels may be at a minimum. A technician was on rather quickly and helped to resolve my issue fast, as well. Signal strength for this router is excellent. I have full wifi through out the entire house. It provides network linking for a large number of devices without degraded speed or signal strength. I will buy Linksys again when the time comed.
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: Great improvement over my old router.
customer_reviews.text: We were having problems with many devices, vs old router which didn't have the capability of handling the traffic. When we would all be on our devices it was like a traffic jam. With this new router, we prioritize streaming. No one gets left out. It seems to have a larger range than our older router also. It has the capability of parental controls, so when my youngster gets her own device, I can apply those if needed. The only problem I came up with is, none of my devices are 5g capable. So that bandwidth goes wasted until I upgrade my devices. I do like also, having a band for guests.
customer_reviews.author: Willowymn

customer_reviews.title: horrible router.
customer_reviews.text: horrible router... switching back to our old single channel belkin... The basics should work out of the box... they don't. I've seen posts that it needs a firmware update and other settings configured. I don't need anything complex, it just doesn't work very well... sad that a 7 year old router beats it hands down. And no it's not connection service, we've switched back and forth a few times and this router nicely put stinks. Sorry, I've always been a fan of linksys and support for dd-wrt, but they are expanding models too much and not making the base product work. :(
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product.  Great support
customer_reviews.text: We got this router less than 6 months ago. Was having some internet issues and connection and reached out to Linksys. My issue was quickly escalated and I got a call the next day from a tech who was very patient and explained what I needed to do. He was easy to understand and took his time making sure I was following and answering my questions as went along. Problem fixed. Great support..great product (too bad my ISP is not). Highly recommend Linksys —we have an extender also which works wonderful.
customer_reviews.author: ksmom4

customer_reviews.title: 5GHtz band is REALLY slow
customer_reviews.text: Other than the title's bit, this router seems to work as expected. We already have a wifi hotspot here that runs from the router, but it uses only the 2GHtz band, up to N. The 5GHtz band, whether using N, AC, or mixed mode is significantly slower than the 2GHtz band on both the router, and the same band provided by the hotspot, no matter what settings I use. Right now, I just use this as a gigabit wired router.
customer_reviews.author: jasoncollege24

customer_reviews.title: Solved all our internet problems.
customer_reviews.text: After much research, I purchased this router and a new cable modem to get my wi fi working properly. Problem solved. This was easy to set up and being able to go online and see all my devices connected and receiving signal is cool. Now, multiple devices are all able to work simultaneously, loading images in emails, getting on the internet, streaming, games, etc. all good. We live in an apartment building and have very slow internet and are running 2 computers, 2 iPads, 2 phones and a 2 smart tvs. Now we are happy.
customer_reviews.author: FAB504

customer_reviews.title: Fast
customer_reviews.text: Had the same model before, it was dropping Wi-Fi connection, the tech support was barely helpful. Got it replaced quickly, without any hassle. This one seems to work fine. I attach a few devices by a cable, and a few tirelessly; the wired connection is fast and stable, wifi went down a couple of times for several seconds. When it works it is fast too: i tested it with several laptops / wifi adapters, get close to the speed advertised by the provider. The SmartWifi software is also useful. So, overall it is a really good product.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Total high speed home coverage
customer_reviews.text: All though the first unit I order was defective, Amazon sent a replacement unit that worked perfectly. Also order AC1900 range extender which once installed maximized my home coverage. I could not be nor pleased with the results achieved. I now have total high speed coverage through out my home with zero dead spots.
customer_reviews.author: Donald W. Bowers

customer_reviews.title: Works good but could be better.
customer_reviews.text: This router works as it is great. I did not give them 5 Stars because for almost a hundred dollars I would think that this router would allow you to have a guest network. They need to put this in there description, I sold the router to someone else and bought one that would allow me to have a guest network for friends.
customer_reviews.author: Darrell R

customer_reviews.title: Slowly declined to limited ability overall
customer_reviews.text: Product worked fine for a while. Speeds slowly seemed to have dropped over the course of the year. Recently the ability to administer the router has become defective. Even after several reboots and resets to factory, the router does not allow certain admin functions via smartphone or connected PC. Since beyond return date will be upgrading to different brand/option with newer architecture.
customer_reviews.author: Roul Duke

customer_reviews.title: No signal strength loss with multiple electronics!
customer_reviews.text: This router replaced a smaller/cheaper Linksys router that was approximately 5 years old. This router significantly boosted the wireless signal in our house and I am loving the dual-band capabilities. We have two smart phones, one tablet, two computers, two televisions and we watch Netflix often and haven't lost signal strength at all since getting this router. (We don't use ALL of the electronics at one time, but I provided the list for a prospective on what could be drawing signal at any moment).
customer_reviews.author: Jessiwaka

customer_reviews.title: Was a great product. Up and running no more.
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Up and running. Wow, 5ghz network is very fast although range is less then 2.4. Well worth the money. ** Update ** Less then a month, router will not broadcast SSID, no wireless. Talked to Linksys Technical Support. Unit will be replaced. I have to pay for shipping back since I didn't buy it from Linksys. 3-7 business days before I get a new one. Good thing I have my Airport Express. May not be as fast, but, "it just works". Downgrading to 3 stars. Doesn't matter how fast it is if it doesn't work.
customer_reviews.author: M. Ditta

customer_reviews.title: Used in three separate houses and no complaints
customer_reviews.text: I’ve ordered three of these. One being from amazon. All three are in separate houses two of which were gifts and one I personally use. They all work as intended supporting the lastest wireless standards for a reasonable price. I intend to upgrade though to linksys velop system for better coverage. I currently use my AC1750 in a bridge configuration with a WRT1900AC for better coverage but I still have some spotty reception in certain areas. But non the less this product works great and offers great speed and distance. Offers four gigabit Ethernet ports and a USB port for a NAS setup.
customer_reviews.author: Surftheblue

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS ROUTER
customer_reviews.text: This is the most troublesome router I've ever purchased. I bought in 03/2018. For the first few months things were running pretty smoothly. Then, hell broke loose. I've had a horrible time keeping consistent internet connection. Having to reset this router every couple of months was fine until Covid. Now it's weekly. I can't stand it. I have had Linksys routers since I can remember, and even turned my family towards them. No longer. And their support? Get ready to wait forever to hear from someone. I'm done. There's a reason why these are highly discounted in every store I've looked.
customer_reviews.author: Travis

customer_reviews.title: Great router
customer_reviews.text: My download speed doubled when I installed this new router. I didn't realize it until my old one died, but it was bottlenecking my internet speed. The install on this is easy, and the range and signal quality is much better than my old N router. I have 3 wireless security cameras and with my old router, they would constantly drop signal and then reconnect. They did it many times a day. I just thought it was because the cameras were cheap. With this new router, my cameras NEVER lose signal.
customer_reviews.author: toolness1

customer_reviews.title: Dual bandwidth WiFi router.
customer_reviews.text: This is a dual band router and for those that don’t know & are experiencing trouble trying to watch Netflix or Amazon Prime, the upper band width provides access to the full signal from your internet provider.
customer_reviews.author: Byron

customer_reviews.title: Like the router
customer_reviews.text: Like the router. Had great signal throughout the house until the upgrade. After that it had to be rebooted two and three times a day because the internet would drop out. Internet was fine. Router was fine. Connection between the modem and router not fine. Reset the router back to factory default and did not allow upgrade. Have not had any more problems. Waiting for a new upgrade to fix problems with the upgrade. Other than this programming problem the router would be a five star rating.
customer_reviews.author: MDK

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely worth it... I did lots of research on routers before I bought this one. I was not looking forward to setting it up.. I just knew I would have some problems for sure... Well, I just set this router up with my modem and a couple switchers.. and it was an absolute breeze! Simple instructions and very easy and well designed website to walk through. I can't comment on the service yet much, but everything is working well and seems awesome so far!
customer_reviews.author: W. Bost

customer_reviews.title: Excellent router
customer_reviews.text: Love this router. Set it up with my new 400Mb service & Motorola modem in a couple of hours including all new names and passwords and about 35 devices. No problems at all. Tivo records 3 programs & streams another for my wife while I stream video on my computer without a pause. I also bought an extender - put it in my garage and enjoyed wifi music on my phone in the garden today. This replaced my 3rd D-Link router (slow learner, I guess) and was a pleasant step up - much easier to set up, more features, and better performance.
customer_reviews.author: JustDave1

customer_reviews.title: Better then expected
customer_reviews.text: Better then expected ! I set this up with a Arris SB 6190 Modem. Before tge set up my parents were getting barely 8mbps on a 25 mbps package ! After I set it up they tested at speeds of 27mbps downstairs and 20-25mbps upstairs ! They now have a 50mbps package, downstairs is getting between 48band 52 mbps. Upstairs bounces between 35 and 50, but when I am home I love this system and will probably buy my own lol My father was amazed at how fast hus email loaded and they have now become cord cutters thanks to this. I would recommend this to anybody who wanted to game or steam TV like Sling or Hulu.
customer_reviews.author: Clint

customer_reviews.title: Perfect speed to cut the cable cord
customer_reviews.text: I have a 1200 Sq. Ft. Apt. Recently cut the cable cord. This is perfect for my home. Tripled my 5GHz speeds from my combo modem router. I use the old cable modem router I had purchased as a modem with the linksys. Saved me from buying a new one. I also have 10 assorted devices connected to it and it supports them all easily. I've had it a few months and am really pleased. It even reaches to the pool which is about 100 feet away. I researched several dual band routers and chose this one based one ratings and reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Vbman

customer_reviews.title: Started out great...now it’s $150 paperweight :/
customer_reviews.text: Like several others we started out and were floored with the speed! Upgrading from an old linksys this this was a rocket ship! Then it started randomly dropping connections. Tried all the suggestions others here have posted. Every tweak resulted in the same output. It would work for about a day and then would randomly drop devices. Now I’m a little over 4 months in and have the equivalent of $150 paperweight. I really do not want to drop more $$ on another router but it’s pretty ridiculous as I’m at a loss.
customer_reviews.author: OldPolishWoodworker

customer_reviews.title: Great WiFi router with great speeds and quality user interface on app
customer_reviews.text: Replaced my old Netgear with this one, all my connectivity issues went away. Enough said. This thing is awesome - easy to setup and connect. Haven't taken the time to login to the router and tweak it but the app and web browser interface seems pretty straight forward. Looking into changing the password for each band which I haven't found yet. Other than that, provides great signal coverage and is pretty solid.
customer_reviews.author: Nfabes22

customer_reviews.title: Pretty flakely wireless in my apartment
customer_reviews.text: Speeds are great...when it works. This replaced a Linksys EA6350 which worked great but suddenly died on me. I decided to upgrade to this version, and it's been hit or miss with the connections. My cell phones (Galaxy S7's) are really flakey with this router for whatever reason. I tried tweaking the settings, checking connection issues but nothing seems to help. I'll probably dump this one and try another brand (although even that is hit or miss too) eventually.
customer_reviews.author: Tempest790

customer_reviews.title: Good signal strength and easy to setup
customer_reviews.text: This router gives a good signal on both 2.4 and 5 GHz bands in our 1300 sq ft apartment. It is place in a room on one end and the signal is great at the other end too. Much better than the Verizon FIOS quantum router. The guest network option is a useful feature. The setup was straightforward - minor issue is that changing most settings causes the signal to drop out for a few seconds. Keeping fingers crossed on getting periodic updates to the driver software.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Router
customer_reviews.text: I went through 2 ASUS RT-ACRH13 models that were terrible and settled on this Linksys model. It was easy to setup, it works flawlessly and has all the power I need. It is considerably larger than the ASUS, but it works both wireless and through LAN. The wireless speed on my laptop is as fast as the cable connected machine. I can stream 4k from Netflix and I can still work. The upload speed is just as impressive. I am on Xfinity 150 getting 180mbps consistently using a Aris modem
customer_reviews.author: Bern N.

customer_reviews.title: Look elsewhere! Range stinks.
customer_reviews.text: Should have paid attention to other reviews on Wi-Fi range! I figured with all the antennas that it would blow away the standard U-verse Motorola modem/router, but it's actually worse range! Beam forming...Bs!!! I'd return it if I hadn't purchased the protection plan on it also. About the only positive is that it has separate guest Wi-Fi access. Setup was a pain since you have to actually plug in PC to router for initial update. My desktop and modem are in separate rooms so a bit annoying running Ethernet cable that far. Need app to setup with smartphone which current app only works after initial setup.
customer_reviews.author: robert gordon

customer_reviews.title: Linksys FTW
customer_reviews.text: awesome product. so far so good. it also has a very easy to use app to control the wifi router. i trust linksys as they just last. my last linksys never broke after 12 years of use. and i actually use it as a back up. i only changed to upgrade my wifi router. great product would highly reccomend buying this again.
customer_reviews.author: higuy

customer_reviews.title: Works great and great tech support
customer_reviews.text: I've been using it for a year and it works great. After this weekend's multiple power failures and 3 days without internet from our cable company, I couldn't get router to work. Called support and they helped me trouble shoot - they not only had me power-down both modem and router, but then reset while it was off, and then reset while it was on. It's working! With the combination of great service for a year, coupled with great tech support, I've got to give it a 5.
customer_reviews.author: Walter B

customer_reviews.title: my old $40 tplink is far more better than this.
customer_reviews.text: few issues I noticed for the past one month of use. 1. keep dropping internet connecitons, drops randomly, hard to reproduce. happens to multiple laptops. 2. unstable speed. sometimes it's fast, sometimes it's slow, again, this happens randomly to multiple laptops., hard to reproduce. Missed the return window, but still will swich back to tplink. I am a computer programmer, so I don't think I config it wrong.
customer_reviews.author: MKMR

customer_reviews.title: Strong signal, works great with my hot spot
customer_reviews.text: I have only had this for about a week but so far it has worked as promised. I am using this with a mobile hotspot as no internet providers are available where we live. I was worried that it might have problems communicating with my device but had no issues in set up. Provides a much stronger signal then my previous router. I now get signal in places that had none previously. So far I am happy with my purchase and will update this if problems do arise.
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: P....O....S....
customer_reviews.text: This router is a piece of JUNK! Our Spectrum router was better than this thing. I have to reset this thing more than any router I’ve ever owned. Don’t waste you’re money on this thing. I can be sitting 10 to 20 feet away and can’t get on the web. But I will day they their user app work great, very user friendly. Too bad the actual equipment doesn’t.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie

customer_reviews.title: Difficulty Installing but does as advertised
customer_reviews.text: The instructions should say it is easier to use SmartWiFi for the installation by using a second computer. Finally had Geek Squad install it and he used his laptop to install. I use WiFi for home use to supply internet to wife’s computer, thermostats and watering system, plus laptop. Had to install Extender to operate watering system located in my garage area.
customer_reviews.author: RichS

customer_reviews.title: Ultra stable router and easy to configure when you need to
customer_reviews.text: This thing works awesome and takes the heat of my home well. My computer area easily gets to 90 and a lot of routers die pretty quickly from this. Usually the WiFi is what goes, but not this router. I rarely restart the router, it runs smoothly for extend periods of time. The router has good range and I had to do very little configuration on it. I am not a network guy so ease of use is important to me.
customer_reviews.author: Trashy

customer_reviews.title: AirPlay Streamers Beware
customer_reviews.text: Although this is a relatively modern router, it struggled to provide a consistent AirPlay connection to various HomeKit and AirPlay devices around the home. I even placed the products within a few feet of the router, and it still regularly dropped the connection on both factory settings and with the relevant configuration items changed. Ended up having to return this and replace this with a different brand (AmpliFi), and the streaming issues went away immediately. I would be careful about buying these if media streaming is a priority, especially since the signal strength isn't much to write home about anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Business Turtle

customer_reviews.title: PARENTAL CONTROLS require user to modify router settings before they work
customer_reviews.text: Parental controls did not work until I manually disabled IPv6. Now they seem to be working finally. Had to figure this out on my own by researching online and testing settings until I finally found the right one - see Connectivity - Internet Settings - IPv6 (which I manually disabled). Why sell me a car with a disconnected radio laying on the passenger seat floor???
customer_reviews.author: mikro88

customer_reviews.title: Very powerful and far-reaching
customer_reviews.text: We have a brick house and we had trouble with getting Wi-Fi in certain areas of the house before. After purchasing this, we have Wi-Fi in every room as well as pretty far out onto our property. This is a powerful little unit and I recommend it for anybody who is having trouble connecting there wi-fi.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph W.

customer_reviews.title: Impressively Simple
customer_reviews.text: Almost plug n’ play. Two minutes on the website and it fired up nicely in all parts of our modest-size home of 1200 sq. ft. Unlike my previous routers (one was a Linksys) I didn’t have to tinker to get both channels and to get the Chrome dongles working for our non-smart TVs.
customer_reviews.author: Easternart

customer_reviews.title: Like a Rocket !!!
customer_reviews.text: I have installed this Router in living room and connected WiFi from upstairs and even from basement. As shown on the photos the speed is too fast, I have never experienced this speed with my other routers. It works excellent with Verizon as well.
customer_reviews.author: Nady

customer_reviews.title: Great until it stopped working
customer_reviews.text: The router performed well and provided better speeds then my previous one of a different brand. However, this AC1750 (EA7300) router quit working after 9 months. If you scroll down the page to warranty info and open the PDF you'll see there is no warranty offered by Amazon, only the 30 day return policy and Linksys will not warranty it either as it was purchased on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Love this router
customer_reviews.text: Got this when our older Linksys was going slow after 8 years. This router rocks. Love the user interface, takes a little getting used to if you're used to the older style. But I have gotten used to it and love the ease of browsing through settings now. Also love if the internet connection is dropped the Linksys logo on top of the router flashes off and on, and stays lit steady if all is good.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Keeps Losing Connection
customer_reviews.text: I've had this router for about 4 months and 'when' it works, it works great, but I keep losing Wifi connectivity. From what I've seen in the other one star reviews I'm not the only one...which is sad because I've always like Linksys and I haven't had a bad experience with them before. Save your money and buy something else.
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: This Router is very easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: This Router is very easy to set up, It does everything we need it to do. we have 2 fire sticks, 2 tablets, 2 laptops, 2 Desktops, 2 cell phones on the Linksys AC1750 Dual-Band Smart Wireless Router, all of the items run without problems, and run at top speed. We stream everything. If this sound like you I say buy it . its great price and functionality you can't go wrong, *UPDATE* We have had this product now for a few months ITS absolutely the best router we have ever owned. ITS THE BEST BANG FOR THE BUCK
customer_reviews.author: Faith Stevenson

customer_reviews.title: Whole house signal.  Easy setup
customer_reviews.text: The router was very easy to set up. The signal is lower in the remote parts of our 2,500 sq ft., 2 story house but not enough to affect streaming connections anywhere. No need to add our Wi-Fi Extender! With my Spectrum supplied Arris modem Model TM1602 I now get 225mbps down and 12mbps up. Yes, that's 225mbps!
customer_reviews.author: RoBro

customer_reviews.title: Poor signal range
customer_reviews.text: I bought this router thinking that it would be an improvement over my Netgear wndr4500v3. I used it for a few months and realized that I could not get a good signal outside like I used to. I need to mount some wireless cameras outside and I almost bought a repeater but then I remembered that I still had the Netgear. The speed was no better either. Glad I kept the old one.
customer_reviews.author: Mel

customer_reviews.title: This one is perfect. The old one just did not reach across ...
customer_reviews.text: We have added several tablets and two computers over the last few years. We needed to update our router . This one is perfect. The old one just did not reach across our house, (an average 3 bedroom ranch house) I can't tell you how much the improvement has been. No more dropped websites and much stronger wifi reception. I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Billie Brown

customer_reviews.title: Lynksys Router 1750
customer_reviews.text: This router replaced a 15 yr old Linksys which had served us well. It just needed updating !! The install was not the easiest thing to do...however, calling Linksys Customer support solved that problem ! I strongly recommend support, as he led me through the setup...did a software update on the router...and THIS THING WORKS GREAT !!
customer_reviews.author: vkb

customer_reviews.title: very good range coverage
customer_reviews.text: A very capable dual channel router, very good range coverage, and easy to set up. Closest WiFi speeds to wired speeds for any router I have ever owned. I give this route 3.5 stars though because after upgrading Internet speed from 50Mbps to 100Mbps and 300Mbps (download), the router would not detect the speed change. After multiple resets of the modem and the router, the only way for the router to pick up the increased speed is to reset the router to factory defaults and upgrade the firmware to the latest again. Perhaps a firmware issue but very inconvenient for the user.
customer_reviews.author: HY

customer_reviews.title: Life saver!
customer_reviews.text: This has been a game changer for us! Our WiFi seemed not to like our amazon fire stick. Well we found out with just the modem we weren’t running at full internet speed. We purchased this and it’s been great! We are able to stream TV with no issues. It’s fits in the spot we wanted it to. No complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Keket Jensen

customer_reviews.title: Well designed router for home use
customer_reviews.text: This was a major upgrade for my family. Now that we have teenage kids, our bandwidth is stretched and the old satellite proved router wasn't cutting it. Easy to install and great privacy functions. We now have a guest log in as well as a family log in. Easily handles kids streaming/gaming as well as the adults streaming Netflix and Amazon on a nightly basis.
customer_reviews.author: Dutch

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Setup & Good Parental controls
customer_reviews.text: Easiest router I've ever setup in my life and I'm 48. I've owned about 8 wireless routers.Good parental controls allowing for time allowed each day Wifi is on to any specific device. I set my son's PS4 to not get WiFi from 12 midnight to 6 AM. Wireless signal is good all over my main level of my house that's 2250 sqft. Best router I've ever owned.
customer_reviews.author: Casey  Ruffell

customer_reviews.title: Works Great.
customer_reviews.text: I needed a more powerful router in my home. My wife was having a connection problem on her Ipad in our living room. I had a router from quite a few years ago, seemed I needed a router with more up-to-date technology, it worked, she can now connect in the bedroom, far end of the house.
customer_reviews.author: R. Marshall

customer_reviews.title: This definitely helps with my internet speed. I'm using ...
customer_reviews.text: This definitely helps with my internet speed. I'm using 2 Xboxs for turners for my son and grandson's TVs. This enables them to watch there cable shows so I don't have to rent cable boxes. The speed stays consisted and doesn't vary much at all. I've check the speed and it's between 110- 120 mbps. This has help me save a ton of money in the long run of things. I would definitely purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: MICHAEL HODGES

customer_reviews.title: Please don’t purchase this product, rarely works
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this to updated an outdated and slow router, unfortunately this product is 100 times worse than my older router and rarely seems to be connected. I don’t like to give negative reviews however this product truly deserves a 1 star review. —Please DONT purchase this product—-
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: EA7300 Router
customer_reviews.text: This router is more powerful than my old EA6350, and sends a better signal from hallway to TV.
customer_reviews.author: Judy B

customer_reviews.title: Decent range and stable
customer_reviews.text: Range is not awesome but not bad either. Router is on one side of the house and at opposite end get 3 bars out of 5. Speed at opposite end is not as fast as I would like it. Live in a 1600 sq foot home. There are 4 uninsulated walls and one brick wall between it and far end of the house. From center of house and closer it works great with no issues. Have had it a month and working great. I would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Ann

customer_reviews.title: Linksys
customer_reviews.text: I had an older model before what worked for a long time. Cable company upgraded my modem so I upgraded my router to be compatible with the new technology. Works real well, strong signal covering the whole house without any hitch, good streaming with no "buffering" pauses.
customer_reviews.author: Q.L.S.

customer_reviews.title: Bridge it
customer_reviews.text: Have had it up and running for a few weeks and so far so good! I have DSL for our ISP because in my area it's the only provider that's unlimited. I disabled the wifi on the providers combo modem/router and bridged this router in from of it and it's really helped! No drops or buffering or lags
customer_reviews.author: steelhorse

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up as 1
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfectly as advertised. Easy to set up as 1,2,3....route. My second Linksys. The first was a much less expensive model. I replaced it due to connectivity problems. With all of the devices in a home these days using wifi this product has really improved the quality of the connection. Since purchasing it my fire tv box is yet to buffer like it did before and have even added an additional tv and devices to the connection. Not a super tech guy but my kids are very happy and was worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: kc453

customer_reviews.title: Device reverts to factory default when it loses power
customer_reviews.text: I've had this device in my network for several months without any issues. This past week we were having problems with our cable modem connecting to this device, and as part of troubleshooting, we unplugged both units from power. To my surprise this modem reverted back to factory defaults (all my WIFI settings including security/passwords were wiped out). Further investigation revealed that this occurs anytime I power cycle this device. very disappointed... (which i had found this out before the return window closed)
customer_reviews.author: PAUL JONAS DUARTE

customer_reviews.title: This is a great router and excellent value!
customer_reviews.text: I was having all sorts of intermittent Wi-fi drop-offs and problems with a VOIP phone, but I wasn't sure if it was the router or the cable modem... so I decided to replace my old WRT54G router with this new Linksys AC1750 model, and boy am I glad I did! I've had it for almost 3 months now, and don't think I've lost my connection one time. This is a great router and value!
customer_reviews.author: C. Adams

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup, strong signal.
customer_reviews.text: This seems to be a very stable wireless router. In my 2000 sq ft home with spread out areas and walks in between I get good connection all the way to back of house and great streaming so far. Easy to setup. Easy to use menus to twerk settings and easy mobile app to remotely access the router and settings. Oh and none of those multiple lights blinking on the front!
customer_reviews.author: T. Decker

customer_reviews.title: Linksys
customer_reviews.text: I've been a linksys fan for quite a long time, long lasting great products. This does not disappoint. Wifi speeds as fast as hard wiring, which if you're a gamer like myself, is important. Especially if you have multiple systems in multiple rooms and several devices connected all at once, still awesome speeds as if hard wiring. I highly recommend this router to anyone! Owned my last linksys for 8 years, still works wonderfly, gave it to my mother so I could upgrade
customer_reviews.author: S. Wright

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: This router is great. It is loaded with options for configuration and the signal strength is far greater than any other router I have owned. I have deployed 5 of these with my business and all of my customers are happy with this product. I even purchased a range extender for one customer and ended up sending it back because the signal with this router far better than their previous router.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Morris

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased!
customer_reviews.text: I was very skeptical about ordering a router and spending so much. I WAS WRONG! It works absolutely incredibly. So easy to set up AND I love the app feature I can see who is logged in and kick my kids off at bed time. We have 8 cameras monitoring our property and the cameras record real time now with no delay or blurry vision.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup
customer_reviews.text: This access point was easy to set up and has decent range on the 5Ghz band. If you follow the setup instructions it could not have been easier and connecting all of our devices to it was just as easy. Hard to tell yet what splitting up all the devices between the two bands is going to do for our speeds but we expect good things. Linksys products have always been of high quality.
customer_reviews.author: Jim T

customer_reviews.title: Replacement for Fios Router
customer_reviews.text: bought as a replacement for Fios Router to avoid paying the $12.00 monthly rental and try to improve overall coverage in the house. I Keep router downstairs in our home office. The Fios WiFi was poor upstairs, especially in corners of the house. I am not the most tech-savvy person; the Linksys router was easy to set up, provides full coverage to the entire house and provides extra options, such as prioritization which I find helpful. I have 100/100 service and it easily handles all our Ethernet/WiFi needs. Dropping the monthly charge will pay for the device in 8-9 months; why did I not do sooner?
customer_reviews.author: Anastasia

customer_reviews.title: Great streaming
customer_reviews.text: The setup wasn't as easy as I'd hoped. However, after an hour with my local Internet provider's tech support, everything was up and running. It streams very well inside and outside my small house; it has two different streaming speeds; and I'm excited to have a guest wifi. I also really like the app.
customer_reviews.author: Tessa Clark

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Worked the very first time after setting up. Significantly increased my Wifi coverage over the older Linksys router. Very pleased with it's performance thus far.
customer_reviews.author: Harry

customer_reviews.title: Avoid Linksys
customer_reviews.text: I bought a router that was faulty, but it was still covered under the warranty. I called numerous times to get them to send me a new one. Every time i called, I was put on hold for an extended period. I was on hold for about a total of 2.5 hours until I eventually i gave up and bought a netgear. I still have a broken router that's under warranty that's just taking up space. Terrible customer service, save yourself the hassle.
customer_reviews.author: Andreas Sofocleous

customer_reviews.title: The router works well with several devices running simultaneously without lag or buffering.
customer_reviews.text: This was recommended by the technician who installed my Wi-fi. It has performed well but is troublesome to connect to the modem. I have had to reinstall it several times. The technician that assisted me with the issue was very helpful and knowledgeable.
customer_reviews.author: PJMac

customer_reviews.title: Great WiFI
customer_reviews.text: It was time for an upgrade. Works great. Easy to install. Fast..........checking speed at modem & thru wifi........the same, no drop. 3,000 sf house, great coverage. Also, good coverage (70%) in the 3,000 sf basement.
customer_reviews.author: dewdew

customer_reviews.title: EASY SETUP - STOP HERE
customer_reviews.text: I needed a new wireless router after my TP-Link dies. I was looking for something that would provide excellent range in our house (its not located in optimum position in the house) and MOST IMPORTANTLY was easy to set up. Got the Linksys today and had it up and running in about 30 minutes, not bad for a techno idiot.
customer_reviews.author: JWP

customer_reviews.title: It was a necessary buy. I'm glad I did.
customer_reviews.text: I had been needing an upgrade for a while. Weak spots in the house seemed to be getting bigger at a faster pace. Kept having buffering issues with the streaming apps on multiple tvs. I finally bought this router and it was a quick setup. No more buffering problems and as far as I can tell I don't have any weak/dead spots in my wifi.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: Well worth it!
customer_reviews.text: This router met my expectations and then some! Easy to get up and running. No more issues with getting a wifi signal from the basement to the second floor! The only thing that keeps me giving it 5 stars is the manual that comes with it...not at all complete...had to guess where the WPS button was, for example. A good, solid router though and pleased with it's performance!
customer_reviews.author: Al Maberry

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Router
customer_reviews.text: This is probably one of the best routers I've worked with. Plenty of coverage through out my house. Strong 5G connection with very little saturation (if any). The application though needs some imporvement. I have this set up in my house and my mothers house, the app fails to reconnize the difference and throws it into a loop when switching between accounts.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Tremendously easy setup, great range
customer_reviews.text: The total time to switch from my old router to the Linksys was about 15 minutes. This included reassigning the wifi addresses on 3 Rokus, an Ooma, and 2 smart phones. I have a NAS drive and a SmartHub which reconnected to the new Linksys router with zero issues. Also, with the Linksys AC1750, the 2.4 and 5g bands are assigned automatically so no guess work on which to use. The signal strength is so much stronger than my previous router too.
customer_reviews.author: George E White

product_meta.title: Linksys EA7300 Dual-Band WiFi Router for Home (Max-Stream AC1750 MU-MIMO Fast Wireless Router)
product_meta.description: Style:AC1750Wi Fi for all. Family no longer has to negotiate for home Wi Fi; everyone stays connected with the Max Stream AC1750 Router (EA7300). It eliminates buffering for everyone in your household. Next Gen AC Wi Fi Multi User MIMO Technology – is like a dedicated router to multiple devices at the same time, same speed. Enjoy Seamless Roaming when you air the Max Stream EA7300 Router to a Max Stream Range Extender enabling your device to switch to the strongest Wi Fi signal as you move freely throughout a home. Plus, with a 1 year warranty, dedicated tech support and the updated Smart Wi Fi app, you can take advantage of great features to help manage your home Wi Fi from anywhere, anytime. Refer to page 15 in User Manual for troubleshooting steps.
feature_bullets: Provides up to 1,500 sq. ft. of WiFi coverage for 10+ wireless devices
Works with existing modem, simple setup through Linksys App. Minimum System Requirements-Internet Explorer versions 8 and newer, Safari 5 (for Mac), Firefox 8, Google Chrome
Enjoy 4K HD streaming, gaming and more in high quality without buffering
Dual band WiFi speeds up to 1.7 Gbps (2.4 GHz / 450 Mbps) + (5 GHz / 1300 Mbps)
MU MIMO (Multi User Multiple Input Multiple Output) provides WiFi to multiple devices at once, at the same high speed

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars10,858 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
